Components

Buttons

Colors

There are six predefined button styles, each serving its own semantic purpose.

Copy

Conveying meaning to assistive technologies

Using color to add meaning only provides a visual indication, which will not be conveyed to users of assistive technologies – such as screen readers. Ensure that information denoted by the color is either obvious from the content itself (e.g. the visible text), or is included through alternative means, such as additional text hidden with the .sr-only class.

Button tags

The .btn classes are designed to be used with the <button> element. However, you can also use these classes on <a> or <input> elements (though some browsers may apply a slightly different rendering).

When using button classes on <a> elements that are used to trigger in-page functionality (like collapsing content), rather than linking to new pages or sections within the current page, these links should be given a role="button" to appropriately convey their purpose to assistive technologies such as screen readers.

Link
Copy

Outline buttons

In need of a button, but not the hefty background colors they bring? Replace the default modifier classes with the .btn-outline-* ones to remove all background images and colors on any button. If you want to further deemphasize the button, you can remove the outline by adding border-0.

Copy

Sizes

Fancy larger or smaller buttons? Add .btn-lg or .btn-sm for additional sizes. Create block level buttons—those that span the full width of a parent—by adding .btn-block.

Copy

States

Buttons will automatically display slightly differently when they are active, but you can still force the same active appearance with .active (and include the aria-pressed="true" attribute) should you need to replicate the state programmatically. You can also show buttons to be disabled. Note the differences below for the markup of disabled buttons and disabled links.

Active link Disabled link
Copy

Border radius

Remove our custom class .rounded-ends to make a button more square. To make corners perfectly square also add .rounded-0.

Copy

Checkboxes

Make sure to include FontAwesome in your project for the checkmarks to display correctly.

Copy

Radios

Copy

Inline

Group checkboxes or radios on the same horizontal row by adding .form-check-inline to any .form-check.

Copy
Copy

Form Inputs

Here are examples of .form-control applied to each textual HTML5 <input> type. For more examples, checkout Bootstrap's forms section.

Copy

Validation states

See Bootstrap's validation states by filling out this form. This example is using a jQuery form validation plug-in that adds the error message and FontAwesome icons to the form based on your input. PennyMac has an organization-wide commercial license for this plug-in. The files can be downloaded from Google Docs here. The plug-in is highly customizable, see the docs for more info.

See the Pen Form Validation by Jackie Johnston (@jackiejohnston) on CodePen.

Input groups

Place one add-on or button on either side of an input. You may also place one on both sides of an input. You can use .border-left-0 or .border-right-0 on the input in order to remove the line separating the add-on. And you can change the add-on"s background color to white to further hide the separation of the two elements with .bg-pennymac-white.

$ .00





Copy

Date picker

This datepicker depends on adding Bootstrap-Datepicker and Moment.js along with some custom CSS to initialize and set FontAwesome as the icons.

See the Pen Datepicker by Jackie Johnston (@jackiejohnston) on CodePen.

Copy

Alerts

Alerts are available for any length of text, as well as an optional dismiss button. For proper styling, use one of the four required contextual classes (e.g., .alert-success). Use the .alert-link utility class to quickly provide matching colored links within any alert.

Well done! You successfully read this important alert message.
Heads up! This alert needs your attention, but it is not super important.
Warning! Better check yourself, you are not looking too good.
Oh snap! Change a few things up and try submitting again.

Card

You can use the width classes to adjust the size of these cards.

02.28.17

The Pros and Cons of Adjustable Rate Mortgages

During the home buying process, you are likely to be introduced to a wide variety of mortgage types. While it might seem logical to select a mortgage based upon what your friends or family have chosen, it’s more important to weigh whether or not a mortgage plan fits you and your individual lifestyle.

Sliders

These sliders depend on adding noUiSlider.js and wNumb.js along with some custom CSS and Javascript to initialize and set the options.

See the Pen Sliders by Jackie Johnston (@jackiejohnston) on CodePen.

Copy

Spacing

We are using Bootstrap v4’s new spacing classes for when you need extra padding or margin for an element. You can read about it more in their documents. For Bricks, we have also added corresponding negative margins to Bootstrap's classes. So if you want an element to have margin-right: 1rem !important;, you'd use .mr-3 and if you want an element to have margin-right: -1rem !important;, you'd use .mr--3.

Example
